marketing_description: Fixed Asset Rentals (FAR) extends NetSuite's Fixed Asset Management (FAM) module to support rental and leasing operations. The solution automatically creates serialized inventory items from fixed assets when marked as rentable, manages cross-subsidiary inventory movements, validates customer-item assignments, and automates disposal inventory adjustments. Designed for companies that rent or lease fixed assets to customers while maintaining dual tracking in both FAM and Inventory systems.
technical_summary: FAR integrates NetSuite Fixed Asset Management with Inventory Management by creating a bidirectional linkage between FAM Asset records and Serialized Inventory Items. When a FAM asset is flagged as rentable, the solution automatically generates a corresponding serialized inventory item with proper accounting, enables validation to prevent duplicate customer assignments, nullifies customer locations on fulfillment/receipt transactions, enforces same-subsidiary constraints for cross-subsidiary transfers, and creates inventory adjustments when assets are disposed.

key_features.feature: Automated Inventory Item Creation from FAM Assets
key_features.description: Automatically creates serialized inventory items when a FAM asset is marked as rentable. Links the asset to inventory via custrecord_asset_itemlink and creates an inventory adjustment to add the item to stock with proper serial number tracking.

Maintains mappings between FAM asset types and their corresponding serialized inventory items. Each asset type defines which inventory item to create and which accounting adjustment account to use for inventory movements.

Map/Reduce script processes disposed FAM assets in bulk, automatically creating negative inventory adjustments to remove serialized items from stock while maintaining proper accounting and serial number tracking.
Client-side validation prevents assigning the same inventory item to multiple customers on sales orders and return authorizations. Ensures rental assets are not double-booked.
Automatically clears customer assignments on FAM assets when item receipts, item fulfillments, or invoices are created, ensuring assets are properly marked as available after customer transactions.

Enforces same-subsidiary constraints when enabled via script parameter. Prevents inventory transfer orders and adjustments from moving rental assets across subsidiaries, maintaining proper subsidiary accounting.
Maintains complete serial number tracking from FAM asset through inventory movements, rentals, returns, and disposals. Serial numbers flow from custrecord_assetserialno to inventory detail records.
Manages complete lifecycle: Asset Creation -> Inventory Creation -> Customer Assignment -> Rental/Fulfillment -> Return/Receipt -> Customer Nullification -> Disposal -> Inventory Removal.

scripts.name: NS|UE|FA Inventory Item Creation
scripts.description: Triggers on FAM Asset create/delete. When asset is rentable with serial number and asset type, creates inventory adjustment to add serialized item to stock. On delete, creates negative adjustment to remove from stock.

scripts.name: NS|MR|FA Asset Disposal
scripts.description: Batch processes disposed FAM assets. Searches for disposed assets via saved search parameter, looks up asset type mapping to get serialized inventory item, creates negative inventory adjustment to remove from stock, and flags asset with custrecordnsps_disp_adj_created.

parameters.label: FAM Asset Search Param
parameters.description: Saved search ID for finding disposed assets

scripts.name: NS|CS|Transaction Item&Customer On FAM
scripts.description: Client-side validation on sales orders and return authorizations. When item is selected, searches for FAM assets assigned to same customer with same item. If found, prevents duplicate assignment by clearing item field and showing error.

scripts.name: NS|UE|Nullify Customer Location
scripts.description: After item receipt, item fulfillment, or invoice is created/edited, searches for FAM assets matching customer and items on transaction, then nullifies custrecord_asset_customer to mark assets as available.

scripts.name: NS|UE|Validate Cross Subsidiary
scripts.description: Before creating intercompany transfer orders or inventory adjustments, validates that from-subsidiary equals to-subsidiary when custscript_is_cross_sub parameter is enabled. Prevents cross-subsidiary movements of rental assets.

external_dependencies.description: Core FAM asset record - must exist before deploying FAR solution

bundles.description: Core FAM module must be installed and configured

deployment_notes: Requires NetSuite Fixed Asset Management (FAM) module fully installed and configured. Asset Type Mapping custom record must be created and populated before deployment. Serialized inventory items must be created for each asset type. Script parameters (location, accounts) must be configured post-deployment. Existing FAM assets may require data migration to add rental-specific fields. Consider running disposal Map/Reduce script manually first to validate configuration before scheduling.

business_processes.description: FAM asset is created with asset type, serial number, subsidiary, and cost. Asset is flagged as rentable (custrecord_asset_rentable = true). User Event script triggers, looks up asset type mapping to find corresponding serialized inventory item, creates inventory adjustment with +1 quantity and serial number, posts to configured GL account, updates asset with custrecord_asset_itemlink.

Sales order is created for rental item. Client script validates item is not already assigned to this customer on another FAM asset. If validation passes, FAM asset is updated with custrecord_asset_customer = customer ID. Item fulfillment is created from sales order, transferring serialized inventory to customer.

Item receipt or return authorization is created for returned rental. User Event script searches FAM assets for customer + items on transaction. Nullifies custrecord_asset_customer on matching assets, marking them available for rental. Serialized inventory is received back into stock.

FAM asset status is changed to Disposed. Map/Reduce script runs (scheduled or manual), searches for disposed assets where custrecordnsps_disp_adj_created = false, looks up asset type mapping for serialized inventory item and adjustment account, creates inventory adjustment with -1 quantity to remove from stock, sets custrecordnsps_disp_adj_created = true to prevent reprocessing.

When cross-subsidiary validation is enabled via script parameter, User Event script prevents creating inventory transfer orders or adjustments where from-subsidiary differs from to-subsidiary. Ensures rental assets remain within single subsidiary for proper accounting.

Item fulfillments, receipts, and invoices trigger search of FAM assets to update customer assignments.
Real-time validation prevents double-booking rental assets to multiple customers.

scalability_considerations: Map/Reduce script efficiently handles bulk disposal processing. Search-based architecture supports thousands of rental assets. Client script validation uses paged search for performance. Consider indexing custrecord_asset_customer and custrecord_asset_itemlink fields for large datasets. Disposal Map/Reduce can be scheduled during off-peak hours to minimize performance impact.
maintenance_requirements: Regularly review asset type mappings when adding new rental asset categories. Monitor Map/Reduce script execution logs for disposal processing errors. Periodically validate FAM asset to inventory item links are accurate. Archive disposed assets and historical inventory adjustments per retention policies. Update saved search criteria if FAM status values change.
licensing_implications: Requires NetSuite Fixed Asset Management (FAM) license. Each user creating/editing FAM assets needs appropriate FAM permissions. Inventory management permissions required for processing inventory adjustments. Map/Reduce script consumes governance units - monitor usage in high-volume environments.
training_requirements: Fixed Asset Managers: 2-3 hours on FAM basics, rental flag usage, serial number assignment, asset type configuration
Rental Operations: 1-2 hours on sales order validation, customer assignment workflow, return processing
Accounting: 2-4 hours on asset type mapping setup, GL account configuration, disposal processing, reconciliation
IT/Admin: 4-6 hours on script deployment, parameter configuration, troubleshooting, maintenance
support_model: Custom solution - requires NetSuite developer support for enhancements and troubleshooting. No vendor support available. Recommend internal NetSuite administrator with SuiteScript experience for ongoing maintenance.
upgrade_considerations: Custom solution requires testing with each NetSuite release. Review release notes for changes to FAM module, Inventory Management, and SuiteScript APIs. Test disposal Map/Reduce script after upgrades. Validate saved search still returns correct results if FAM record structure changes. Monitor for deprecated APIs in User Event scripts.
